SENT.plain: AIM: Endoscopic diagnosis of the lateral extension of Barrett's cancer under the squamous epithelium (BCUS) is sometimes difficult because the cancer is unobservable in the esophageal lumen
The aim of the present study was to clarify the endoscopic features of the extension of BCUS and verify the usefulness of the acetic acid-spraying method (AAS) for diagnosis
METHODS: A total of 25 patients with Barrett's cancer who had undergone endoscopic resection were included in this study
Histological examination of patients' resected specimens was performed to identify the presence of BCUS
Then, the endoscopic images of the BCUS cases were reviewed to summarize the findings and to evaluate the feasibility of diagnosing the extent of BCUS with each imaging technique
RESULTS: Of the 25 patients, 10 (40%) had BCUS
With white-light imaging, subtle reddish change was observed in the area of BCUS in 80% of the patients, and a flat elevated lesion was recognized in 30%
With narrow band imaging, slight brownish change was observed in the area of BCUS in 86% of the patients
Slight white changes were visualized in all cases with AAS
The extension of BCUS was correctly diagnosed by white-light imaging, narrow band imaging and AAS in 50%, 43% and 100% of the cases, respectively
Histology verified the opening of cancerous glands, which extended under the squamous epithelium, into the esophagus in the area showing slight white changes by AAS
CONCLUSION: AAS can be useful for diagnosing the extension of BCUS
